page.title: 10FARMING Local Farm
page.content: { {Winkhill Farm { On Thursday 20th June 1985 we went to Winkhill Farm which is just over the by-pass.We went up a drive and passed some cows,we saw some big fish in the moat,they were carp and golden orfe.After we had seen the fish we went to the geese.The females were white with orange beaks and feet and the males were brown and white.There were lots of goslings which were yellow and black.After that we saw the cattle and there were lots of calves.Most of the cows were Lincolnshire Reds and there was one Charolais bull.We walked in the moat which surrounded the mound where Winkhill Manor used to be.At the bottom of the field was a gravel pit,a stone axe head had been found there.
